comments:
I have Mylar installed in my Eclipse [eclipse-SDK-I20070410-1043].

When I start working with the Task List View, I can't open menus from the menu bar.
The menu bar doesn't highlight menu items and I can't click and open menus.

I have the same problem with Eclipse I20070410-1043.
Just desactivate and activate a mylar task, and than it's impossible to open eclipse menus.
(Using Mylar 2.0.0.v20070403-1300)

Do other non-SDK plug-ins work with that integration build?  We saw some problems when briefly trying last week's integration builds and so were avoiding moving to the new ones until next week or the week after, but I'm wondering if there is any indication that Mylar is to blame.
It can be useful information. I use Sun vm 1.5.0_07.

It seems that there must be a platform bug underlying this, because even if a plug-in is behaving badly the menu bar should not break.  I'll try to see if I can reproduce today.

Michael: are you seeing this too?

No, I haven't been able to reproduce it. I've been using the task list mainly as a way to organize my bugs. I've done a bit with the Focused UI but not much and it sounds like this issue is related to that. My VM also differs from Szymon's so that may be a factor.

Thanks Michael.

Szymon: if you can reproduce with the nightly let me know.  My current plan is to wait for the next integration build to test.

(In reply to comment #6)
> Thanks Michael.
> 
> Szymon: if you can reproduce with the nightly let me know.  My current plan is
> to wait for the next integration build to test.
> 
I'm not Szymon but i have tried with N20070413-0010.
It's even worse : now you don't need to select a task to cause the menu to "hang".
I have done a fresh install of Eclipse N20070413-0010 and install Mylar from the "software update" menu (update site http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/e3.3). After the restart of eclipse it's impossible to open menus.
The mylar configuration window don't show up.

There is 4 errors about Mylar in my error log. The last one (the top in the list) is :

ps : I tried with sun vm 1.6.0-b105 and 1.5.0_06

Created an attachment (id=63804)
Log error file

My log error file.

Mylar might not build correctly against that integration build.  I will look into it next week.  Fyi, here is the policy for moving to integration builds: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_User_Guide#Releases

I have tested Mylar with Eclipse I20070417-0800.
Mylar is installed from http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev/e3.3

The problem still exists.

I can reproduce this using Mylar HEAD and I20070417-0800, though not every time, and there is nothing in the error log.

Tod: CC'ing you since this could be a serious Platform/UI bug, because a plug-in doing something weird should not stop the Workench's menus from working.  Also, we have never seen Mylar trigger such a problem with releases prior to I20070410-1043.  Do you or someone else in Platform/UI have a hint as to what could trigger menu bar to stop working (see description)? Should I move this over to Platform?  All that should be needed to reproduce is Szymon's two steps in comment#10, create a few tasks and activate them.
Paul Webster is the owner of the menu space

Once the menu is actually created, it is just an SWT entity.  I'm not sure how the mylar error could cause SWT to stop responding to menu events ... unless mylar is adding any display level filters?

PW

(In reply to comment #14)
> 
> So on the Mylar end this is resolved.  But should I file this as a Platform
> bug?  It seems like the menus should not disappear just because the shell was
> disabled?
> 

AFAIK, that is expected behaviour.  The Menus are not to respond to key events or click events if the shell is disabled.

SWT just fixed a bug on linux where key events were being propagated.

PW

(In reply to comment #15)
> AFAIK, that is expected behaviour.  The Menus are not to respond to key events
> or click events if the shell is disabled.

Paul: note on comment#14 that the shell was being re-enabled in the finally block and the problem is that after being re-enabled the main menu is still dead.  Not sure if this is SWT or the new menus stuff, but while it is no longer a problem with Mylar it could be for other clients, so I filed bug 183577.

Created an attachment (id=64583)
mylar/context/zip
Still fails with Eclipse 3.3 M7.
This should be fixed in the dev builds, most recently 2.0.0.v20070506-2200.  If you could try that and verify that would be great.  Update site is listed at: http://eclipse.org/mylar/dl.php
*** Bug 185831 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The mylar update site does not provide access to the build you specified.  The url listed for Eclipse3.3M7 is identical to the one for Eclipse 3.3 M6.  I installed from this site today and the version of mylar I got was 2.0.0.v20070403-I300.
Perhaps it hadn't replicated yet? The 3.3M7 mylar dev build update site is: http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev/e3.3
I just confirmed that the build version is 2.0.0.v20070506-2200 at http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev/e3.3 (last section of download page).
*** Bug 187489 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
